title: Do you think Prince Harry will regret marrying Meghan Markle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Definitely hope so. I honestly believe that he could do better. Markle knew exactly what she was doing, and didn't care for the criticism which followed. She wanted the title, so she claimed it by spreading her legs after casting the spider wire for which Harry couldn't help but to bite its hook. A true succubus. Resulting in getting pregnant (Trapping) him weither or not they got married she was determined in making everything about them and stilling the spotlight all for herself afterwards. Think about it. A child shared between two people can do just as much damage as one could think. Could be a happy relationship or a hell raising relationship and the only thing tying them is the love for a child. Royal child at that.. And like serveral single Americans can agree. Well a particular percentage. You known who you are…Even when one spouse isn't in the picture. HE OR SHE will still be tied considering that in American the other half can hit the other with child support if needed or wanted to get back at the other just to have an excuse to keep him or her around to make life hell. I’ve seen it! To top the whole thing off. Their move to California just seems like her way of escaping the fact that in the castle her claims are irrelevant when comes to the child and if she wanted to keep close eye on him and do what she pleased. She would have to take chances in leaving somehow for the U.S. under its laws which many states are indeed mother states when fighting in a custody battle. Unsure how well that will play out while fight a monarch but yea. As for Harry. Your on U.S. soil and She has you right where she wants you. Stripped him from what he’s known his entire life, and brought him to her playground. A place she knows and all the packages cali offers and Harry's only there to bring more of a spotlight on her. More then she had before him. The enhancement! Truly hope he has an escape route or a well written and stamped prenuptial set for when she's done being thirsty and searches for something new!

If he doesn't, there is something very wrong with him. I am not naive enough to think the royals are saints (some, like Andrew, are a disgrace) but I do believe MM to be a grifter and worse. William was a loving and protective brother. He was actually fatherly toward Harry in the aftermath of their mother's tragic death. Knowing that Charles was likely relieved by Diana's demise, William clung to Harry and vice versa. Nobody else felt their pain. The two shared a sacred bond. Like any brother who wanted happiness for his sibling, William shared his concern that things were moving too fast. Harry's friends shared the same belief. It was responsible of William to attempt a conversation. Harry was too busy giving into his carnal pleasures to want to assess what Markle's motives truly were. Most of us were aware that the possibility of an unpure motive was worthy of further exploration. MM has proven herself to be worse than any of us could have imagined. She was so jealous of Catherine she couldn't see straight. Ultimately, she decided that if she could not be Top Dog, she'd make an attempt to bring them all down. The ball's in the Queen's Court. To give in to MM, the ultimate Grifter, would be a huge mistake. Meghan is not above blackmail. I think she would be elated to expose the Monarchy's most painful secrets. I have a feeling, however, that MM has plenty of skeletons in her own closet. I think the press has plenty of dirt on her and it will all come tumbling out. The Brits who love Harry need to let go. He is no longer the same person. As Meghan would say, he's been mesmerized by her "magic boobs." Personally, I think Harry and Meghan can be called boobs as well. MM has created horrific karma around herself and things are bound to end badly for her. American news reported today that MM has secured a job with the Disney Company. She is already cashing in on her royal association. I, for one, will boycott all Disney parks and merchandise immediately. Disney represents family and love. Meghan destroys family love for sport and, now, for a living. I hope others will join me in my Disney Boycott. Markle is neither wholesome nor family-oriented. She represents hatred, greed, promiscuity, nudity and more importantly, destroying every person and family that does not support her sick and selfish agenda: world domination.

“Will regret?” If he doesn’t already regret this marriage, then he has bigger problems than Meghan Markle. This is difficult to explain, but Meghan is one of those people who always has something going on in her mind, other than being with you, enjoying your outing. This can be a mostly female trait, and I used to encounter it when I was younger, making new women friends. Now when I observe how MM does what she does, it seems somehow familiar, and reminds me of some of those wannabe friendships. You plan a lunch date or movie or whatever. The day arrives, but she has something else going on, some other agenda. To you, the date is you two having lunch, doing whatever, but she swings it around to fit some other agenda. So she might show up, but then she leaves early because of some other thing she “needed” to do at the last minute. Or, she brings someone with her, one of her friends, and as they converse and bond and the main energy is between them and not you, and they act like you are not even there. If you didn’t desperately want to see that play, go to the beach, watch that game, you might as well just go home and leave the outing to them. So your original plan is cut short and you are left thinking, WTF why did I even bother? The same thing would happen with a man I was dating, who occasionally would ask one of his friends to go with us to…wherever. I didn’t mind this in the very beginning, because it removed some of the stress of a first meeting, first date. But later, as things heated up and we became more intimate, my fantasies about a romantic dinner followed by great sex were dashed to the ground. I later learned to just say “Oh. James is coming with? Then why don’t you two go ahead, and I’ll see you later.” It’s the whiplash effect.

Edit: A completely different answer from what I wrote 18 months ago…. Yes, one thousand times a day, yes. I believe Harry regrets marrying Meghan now. I had to amend my answer from eighteen months ago, where I gave Meghan the benefit of the doubt. I don’t need to do that any longer, since I clearly see how self-centered, egotistical, unkind and cruel Meghan Markle is. Harry must wonder how he managed to enter the seventh level of hell in which he currently dwells.  Look at this. Harry is in a house with Meghan’s bi-sexual lover/friend, Markus Anderson, take your pick, whatever makes you happiest even to the point of naiveté. Now Doria has moved in and she’s not mother of the month material, so why is she even there? Not to babysit Archie. No, that’s for Harry and the nanny. What is Meghan’s mom doing in Perry’s mansion? She was in on the big scheme to get Harry to marry Meghan via the Invictus Games 2017 charade.  It’s okay if you don’t want to believe me. I used to have a difficult time thinking Harry fell for a blackmail scheme of sorts. There must be some strange tape out there of him. Otherwise, Harry would walk out into that California sunshine and walk away from it all. Markus, who reminds me of a diabolical being, has been living with Meghan, and thus, with Harry also, since they moved in January. Cozy? A threesome doesn’t work often.  Are they doing polyamory? How’s Harry enjoying that? Is this what he envisioned when he married Meghan, who absolutely 100% knew she was bagging a prince for a price and dragging him across the ocean to break into show biz? Meghan knew she was destined for greatness. She just had to climb on another man to get there (again, sigh). And nothing has worked for her. Karma, much? What a difference eighteen months makes. Harry must be going through some very trying times in that house, but you know what? I just read that Harry and Meghan both threw Prince William under the bus in their awful book that’s coming out to whine and perpetuate their victimhood, Finding the Door, oh wait, Finding Money, no? Finding ….well, I refuse to write the title down, because I am not suggestively selling it.  Harry deserves to live in that pile of human stew. Enjoy it buddy. You and Meg are mad because the only person who stood up to you was the brilliant one in the family? William! The Queen has a bit of dementia now. Charles has and will always be a wimp. William is a rock. And a rock star in my book, if he was the only one standing up against the two toddlers in this farce, Harry and Meghan.   I really think Boris Johnson better grow a pair and rescind all titles. Harry’s too. Then let Harry, “just Harry” make something out of his life. No handouts. No money. Nothing. People pull themselves together every day. Out of alcoholism (my brother, so yay!), out of homelessness, out of poverty. You can do it too. I have no sympathy left for either Harry or Meghan. Can you tell? I left this up so you could actually see the codswallop I wrote in February 2018. Prince Harry will not regret marrying the Duchess of Sussex, unless she breaks his heart and ever left him. Prince Harry would never leave her, not after seeing what his parents, Princes Charles and Diana, Princess of Wales, went through. And with a child in the mix? Harry would never hurt HRH Meghan. Even if their love grew cold and they lost their passion, still the prince would remain with his wife. As for HRH Meghan? Somedays I want to think she has Prince Harry’s best interests at heart, but then I wonder if she loves him or loves who he is. As terrible as it is to contemplate, I wonder about the Duchess of Sussex’s ability to leap from person to person, having them in her life as long as it suits her. She broke up her first marriage via mail, when Meghan mailed her rings back to her then-husband. Who does that? I wonder if she’ll tire of playing Duchess. She sees HRH Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge, and her future is set. Queen. Is Meghan jealous over Catherine’s destiny? Would being a queen in the distant future be enough to tether Meghan to Harry for life? Or will she see being an obedient duchess as a life sentence and leave? If that happens, then Prince Harry won’t have regrets, he’ll have a broken heart.

upvoters.user_id: Hera Ahmed Raja حِرا احمد راجہ

response.answer_text: Edited for clarity of wording. OK, I’ve read the answers here (plus many others of a similar nature). Whilst I don’t think MM is royal material, who knows if Harry REALLY cares? What he does evidently care about is the seemingly unstoppable press tirade against her. People have short memories. Of the Queen’s children Princess Anne was the first to marry. She chose a “commoner”. Captain Mark Phillips had NO interest in being given a title. He seemed content to lie low, and we don’t know much about the romance - except that they both had a passion for horses and equestrian events. Anne has a temperament like her father’s, won’t stand rubbish, decided her children would not be “Royal”, and we knew little about the marriage till she divorced Capt Mark Phillips. Did she regret marrying him? Who cares. Second husband - a fair bit younger. Again, a commoner. Horrors! It will be a matter of time till she’s divorced! Natter, natter. Seriously, who cares now? She has always worked very hard in her role as The Princess Royal and thus has a commitment to duty, but not the press.Prince Charles courted “a Commner” when he took on Diana. Horror. There was such incessant press prying and pressure that the palace took the unusual step of telling the press to leave her alone. You may say “Ah, but what a charming Princess of Hearts”, but when he first began courting her, she did not appear to be serious wife/Royal material for Charles. Nevertheless agreements were made with the press that some access would be given if they stopped the chasing and bitching about her.Sarah Fergusson. Oh my goodness! Now we had a true horror story. Also a “commoner”. She had a “past”, was called dumpy etc. She stunned them all on her wedding day, but it wasn’t long before foot in mouth disease struck her violently. Her behaviour was pretty awful, but so was that of the press. Who would like to be zoomed in on camera every second even if you WERE having an affair.Sophie Rhys-Jones. Thankfully for the most part Edward and Sophie have flown under the radar. Before she was married, Edward was accused of looking for a wife as closely resembling Diana as he could. Lovely. Sophie was caught short by the press making disparaging remarks about the royal family, but has stuck her nose down since. All sorts of nasty accusations flew about Lady Louise’s eye, including that they refused to have it fixed. They were “hiding her” from the public. (I would have too given the behaviour of the press) The years have gone by, Louise’s eye looks lovely - and no doubt her parents followed medical advice.I’ll leave Camilla to those who have the time of day to write about her. The press have treated her like God’s most awful creation. She has rolled with the punches and frankly, once finally married to Charles, she has done very little to criticise.Next cab off the rank, “Waity Katy”, often ridiculed as waiting too long for her Prince. Her mother was accused of being a greedy socialite determined to turn her daughter into a Royal. Luckily Catherine had behaved beautifully, despite the occasional hiccups along the way.Now Meghan. I think Prince Harry’s true regret is that a decision he made to marry - which is really nobody’s business but his own, in consultation with Her Majesty, is incessantly questioned in the court of public opinion. She tried to make an effort. Tried. Unfortunately, whether it’s her unsuitability, or Prince Harry’s loathing of the press, what they have ACTUALLY produced is a very bitter, unhappy man - once the darling of the press. Maybe Meghan cares about THAT. The “agreement with the press” to behave in exchange for photo opportunities is in tatters. I have no doubt that Harry’s desire to escape is because of that. I have no doubt he wants Archie to be protected from the constant prying as to how much “African American has come through”, and “whether his hair will be frizzy”.There have undoubtedly been worse wives in the Royal family. However, she cannot open her mouth without condemnation and hypocritical ridicule. She has “stolen a Prince”, one that was weary of his role LONG ago. He’d rather be one of the boys in Afghanistan (or the latest area the of conflict or serious duty - not just cutting ribbons). Will they divorce? Probably. Maybe. Will they be the first royals (or semi royals) to do so? No. I just honestly wish the gutter press would shut up and give them at least SOME chance. The hounds may no longer chase the foxes, but the press has a new round of vicious hounds to turn this marriage into a disaster. If you want Harry to NOT regret his decision to marry, get off his case.

I think the writing is more than on the wall - I believe it has now reached the end game stage of the relationship! While of course I am repeating gossip - gossip, supposition and second hand news is all that is available to us - yesterday I heard Harry is now asking himself some questions about the relationship he finds himself in. It appears he is bemused by the fact that the Meghan today is not the Meghan he proposed to, the Meghan he thought he was marrying. He believed her to be sweet, gentle, kind and thoughtful; a woman who really wanted to be by his side while he - and they - performed their duties as senior members of the RF. He also believed that she loved him - in the way Kate loves William. And, with limited experience of either the world outside the RF and of women, he took Meghan at face value. She loves me, he thought, she really loves me; she is going to give up being an actress, move to England and be by my side for the rest of my life. He couldn’t believe his luck! Glamorous, smart, attractive and used to the camera, what was there that could possible go wrong!! In the weeks before the wedding, Harry seemed to be changing a bit - his face in unguarded moments sometimes looked a bit disconnected from Meghan - but I’m sure any doubts he might have had were put down to pre-wedding nerves - and the same for Meghan.  The next couple of years have been well-documented - and the move to Canada followed by LA as been attended by a wealth of speculation and interest. But it has become increasingly clear from various appearances they have made that neither Meghan nor Harry appear to be blissfully happy at the moment. Both look pale and unwell, in spite of sunshine, a swimming pool and 22 acres in which to exercise. If Harry is now wondering what has happened to the woman he fell in love with, it is the beginning of the end. He is also said to be considering his options: he could leave with Archie - but how would Meghan react if he were to do that. He could leave without Archie - and then what would happen? What would Meghan do then - would she allow him back to see his son, take him to the UK at all? And then there would be lawyers and court cases and custody battles and financial settlements - where would it all end? And then there’s the last option: stay where he is and put up with the situation, whatever it is and wherever it leads. If he is really questioning his whole relationship with Meghan, then at least it means he is recognising it is not what he thought - and hoped it would be. He appears aware that something has to change - but at the moment, he has no idea how best to deal with it. I am sure, however, there are people working behind the scenes to ensure that, whatever the long term outcome, it is the best not only for Harry but for Archie and Meghan as well.

upvoters.user_id: Woman Too Have Same Rights as Men

response.answer_text: Yes as someone who was married to some real evil women (and also some very nice women) I do. You see good people have no defense against evil people, people that are good at exploiting people. Do you not think for a starlet of minor fame this marriage was not a publicists dream. You have on the one hand, some would be actress who has been through the mill of Hollywood casting processes and a nice person who grew up in a household where principles of honour and integrity are the byword. A man with very little experience of women. While she cant be said to be a suckling lamb. How easy it is for a woman to take advantage of someones good will, we are talking about a womn who has been trough the mill of Hollywood, who is admitted into a family that is absolutely nothing like her original brood and her despicable father. So Harry seems to be committed as a gentleman should be but unfortunately this world takes Gentleman and chews them up and spits their bones out. I wish him all the best but when he does find out what a mistake he made he will still be Prince Harry but that ambitious starlet will be another opportunist who exceeded her wildest dreams. The question is how long this charades will go on. Mrs Simpson fucked up Edward the VII ths life so let see how much how much this bitch fucks Harry’s up. Also what was the rush in having a kid when the situation is so changeable in your life. The objective was to use the kid as insurance, a guarantee, poor little kid is hostage that guarantees she cant be discarded like she should be, when the time comes and an emotional tie for life, not to mention the handsome alimony that she wouldget. The most criminal thing is that Harry will be a member of two worlds for the time being, belonging to neither, just collateral damage by a calculating bitch on her way to the top. Then one one day like in Prousts Remembrance of Things Past, Prince Harry will say to himself “All this for a woman who wasn't even worth it"

No. Not a chance.Why would he? We must remember that Harry was pretty much the most eligible bachelor in the world following Prince William's engagement. He has probably had women throwing themselves at him since he could remember. Do you not think he has the basic intelligence, experience and instinct to spot a gold digger when he sees one? Do you think Harry would have fallen for Meghan if there was any indication that she was anything other than what he needed? And flip it this way. What would it take to get the most desirable man to fall in love with you? Looks? There are loads of prettier, younger women. Shrewd cunning? Harry would see through it. Money and connections? Ha ha. It is clear that Meghan has something that Harry wanted. Something that made him feel loved, safe and cared for. We will probably never know what it is. But it is undeniably there. And is still there. The people who call Meghan a toxic gold digger clearly cannot see this. Harry hates the press and loves his family. The press ( and by extension social media) hates his wife and attacks her. Is it really so hard to believe that he would want to move them away from this poison? Why would this be any indication of a deteriorating relationship with Meghan? No. Harry has no reason to regret his marriage to Meghan (that we know of). He is a wise man who had to distance himself from his old family to protect his new one . All this would have fuelled his hate for the press, not his wife. Harry and Meghan will probably lay low for the next decade or so. They will probably turn up for the really important events like Prince Charles' eventual coronation (during which they will no doubt attack her. Harry will probably look grim and this will be taken as proof that he now hates Meghan. Archie will probably scrowl at some point which will be proof of Meghan's abuse. Meghan will probably be caught smiling during the coronation which will be proof of her happiness at the Queen's death. Or she wont smile which will be proof of her unhappiness at Prince Charles' ascension). At any rate, the Sussexes will probably wait out this shit storm until the sewer press and haters get tired of this and move on to gossiping about other royals whose lives they know nothing about. And then, I would hazard that they’ll move back to Britain. Not expecting that to happen until 10-20 years from now. But divorcing Meghan? Nah. Probably not gonna happen going by the current scenario.

Yes, I do. Prince Harry only wanted to ‘Feel Free ‘of the royal family, but didn’t want to actually Be Free’ of the royal family. Along came Meghan ,who knew just how to work him to her advantage.She got her title ,but she is not really any more royal than the rest of us. She married ‘H’ to get it. Tired of doing walk abouts and meet and greets was when the whine took over. Can someone get her some cheese to go with that please???? She has/had big plans until the Queen thwarted the Instagram account. Sorry for all the Likers of MM but just recall a few incidents should cause you to pause. The biggest and saddest so far is treatment of her father. Have her wedding wait until he is well is what a normal,feeling,loving daughter would do. ! Insist that her future husband be introduced to the man that brought you up, took you to the TV station every day while he worked and where you got this grandiose opinion of yourself.! Try to insist on air fresheners for the church is absolutely laughable! Real Royalty have such great reverence for the church that kings,Queens, Princes, Heads of State, Princess’ etc reverently walked proudly before ‘Miss L.A.’ came along with ‘I Want Beach Breeze ‘fragrance .! Quibbling about which tiara she wanted. Such inappropriate behavior on so many levels. The only good thing to enhance Prince Harry is that lovely baby. Now she knows that whatever happens he’s hooked. I could write a book myself about her using just plain facts. No need for gossip or papers. It's all right out there. Harry never had a chance.

Trying to second-guess other people is hard, even if we know a lot about them from the constant publicity. But my feeling is that the differences will sooner or later be too much to handle and there will be a separation and maybe a divorce. Harry has tried to get out of the media pressure cooker that he lives in by in effect resigning from the royal family. His apparent intention is to have a “normal” family life, insomuch as that will ever be possible, and in many ways that is commendable, but I feel that he is trying to run away from problems that will follow anyway, anywhere. So what is it with Meghan? For someone who is supposed to be a competent actress, she has been singularly unable to play the role of a royal. It is a representative job, pure and simple; keep smiling, make feel-good small talk to the general public, be a ray of sunshine, be the sponsor of good causes, and keep smiling. Oh, and keep your knees together, never cross your legs. Meghan can’t do this. Insider gossip says that the staff at the palace could not stand her and her foibles, plus she appears to have a remarkable lack of empathy for other people. And that spills over into her public appearances. They say that men marry their mothers, but Meghan is no Princess Diana who charmed the public. Otherwise, she lacks decorum. She seems to provoke arguments and rancor. She does not seem to have a good relationship with the other royals, and especially the Queen, and she is driving Harry and William apart. She is in a people job, and she is not good with people. She gives the impression, rightly or wrongly, that she just wants the lifestyle, the money, the plaudits and the baubles. In other words, a nouvelle riche who bagged a wealthy aristocrat. She must know of this, she must know that she is is inevitably being compared to Wallis Simpson, and she does nothing to deflect this criticism, or to inspire genuine affection. The key word is genuine; does she have genuine affection for anyone apart from herself? If she thinks she is creating a modern fairy tale, she may end up as the wicked witch rather than the princess. But it could change if she so wishes. And it would be better for all concerned if she did. And maybe, who knows? She might even read this.

Sadly, yes. In my opinion MM shows all the traits of having Narcissistic Personality Disorder. If I am correct, the relationship will go through the following phases: Lovebombing / Idealisation Phase - when the narc pulls out all the stops to position herself as his soulmate. She will carefully probe his inner being, and then mirror back to him exactly what he wants to hear. He will be overjoyed at having met someone who seems so perfect, so ideally matched, so loving and lavable. Sadly this phase is all a charade designed to ensnare her victim.Devaluation - during this phase, the dynamic changes. Whilst working hard to maintain a charming outward appearance, behind closed doors she will insidiously abuse her victim - subtle psychological, emotional and mental abuse. He will start to lose his mojo, self-confidence, esteem and identity. She will slowly and subtlety isolate him from friends, family and support. Whilst he loses himself, she becomes the centre of attention as more treacherous plans are put into action. This phase is all about deriving what is called narcissistic supply - control, fame, wealth, attention, advancement.Discard - as the victim runs out of things to offer, and his ability to provide the narcissistic supply she needs by the bucketload, so she will plan the discard. Isolating him becomes a high priority, as does setting him up for the fall - smearing him behind his back, framing him with false allegations, blending grains of truth with bucket loads of lie to position herself both as hero and victim, and him as villain.Mission to Destroy - with the discard now out in the open, so she will move to destroy him. Vicious lies spread by Flying Monkeys, intolerable psychological and emotional abuse, she ill use her kids as weapons to beat him with. Expect parental alienation, financial abuse, and ghosting as she does all she can to push him over the edge - thereby silencing the potential whistleblower, maximising on the sympathy she gets, and generating the most amount of attention.There is clear evidence to suggest we have seen the love-bombing and devaluation phases. Is the move to Canada to maximise his isolation from his family so that she can move to Discard and Mission to Destroy unopposed? I fear so. These will be testing times for Prince Harry. NPD affects 6.2% of the general population. Very few people understand it, including most psychologists. Jekyll & Hyde personalities, it is safe to say that they are behind the vast majority of the world’s evil. The clinical criteria for diagnosis bear an uncanny resemblance to the Seven Deadly Sins. They walk amongst us - and can usually have the most engaging, heart-warming smiles. If you have lived to survive narcissistic abuse, give yourself a big hand. If you’d like to know more, please follow me - I write exclusively on the subject. NPD Life Coaching & Consulting - Stewart Cook See also Stewart Cook's answer to How do you know if you are in an emotionally abusive relationship? Stewart Cook's answer to Why am I so traumatized by narcissistic abuse? Stewart Cook's answer to What was the biggest mistake made by Meghan Markle?

Reading down the replies, I am amazed at the amount of bitchiness and gossipy vitriolic nonsense. It's embarrassing that grown women are whimpering about the Duchess’ hair looking messy and that her constant lock of hair keeps slipping out on purpose just to give her that California look. Seriously? How ridiculous can people get? It's like listening to 6 year kids. I think he loves her more than ever and will be willing to give up being a working Royal and will be prepared to fade out of public life to allow his family to be happy and not undergo this constant tirade of bullying and lies. I think she genuinely loves Harry and will 100% back his decision and they will quietly go off and do their own thing quietly, coming out in support of the issues they care about. She'll either announce a second pregnancy in the next 12 months or they will wait and see how things go over the next 2 years before deciding whether to stay as working Royals or not. If they choose a life out of the public eye, they will have baby no2 then. Or I could be completely wrong. But I doubt it. No one in their right mind puts up with what the press and social media harpies have put them through unless they truly love each other.

Lots of great answers here. To fully answer this question, we have to go Harry’s past. What has Harry said? What did he want to do? What was his call in life? Since Harry was very young, he fell in love with Africa. According to a Buckingham Palace spokeswoman: “He first visited the continent at the age of 13 and more than two decades later, the people, the culture, wildlife and resilient communities continue to inspire him and motivate him everyday.”  In January 2017, Harry stated about his first trip to Africa back in 1997: “My dad told my brother and me to pack our bags — we were going to Africa to get away from it all. My brother and I were brought up outdoors. We appreciate nature and everything about it. But it became more…This is where I feel more like myself than anywhere else in the world.”Harry on his first trip to Africa where he met the Spice Girls at a charity concert in Johannesburg, 1997:  Based on his statements, we know that it is Africa where he feels at home, where his heart is. Throughout the years, Harry has done a lot of charity work: helping Aids orphans in Lesotho, witnessing land mines clearance in Angola, a motorbike trek across South Africa to raise funds, assisted in wildlife conservation work, etc. All of these actions show us his strong bond with Africa.    Why is Africa so important? Harry said that he felt an immediate connection to the children he met there because many have also lost a loved one at a young age. He acknowledged that their situations were different still, he felt related to them. Needless to say the loved one he lost was his mother, Princess Diana. Harry stated back in 2017: “I will always look up to her as being my ideal role model.” He wanted to honor his mother through his charity work:     Harry indeed loved this place, he loved it so much he took his girlfriends there:  When he met Meghan, what did Harry do? He also took her to his safe place, his second home:  Harry took Meghan to Meno A Kwena Safari retreat in Bostwana where prices start at $495.  This is the place where they fell in love and camped under the stars:  During their famous engagement interview, Harry said: "I managed to persuade her to come and join me in Botswana. We camped out with each other under the stars... she came and joined me for five days.” Harry persuaded Meghan to go to Africa, but in less than two years, Meghan managed to persuade Harry to come and join her in Hollywood:  In 2019, Harry stated: “I wish I could spend more time in Africa. I have this intense sense of complete relaxation and normality here. To NOT get recognized, to lose myself in the bush with what I would call the most down-to-earth people on the planet, people [dedicated to conservation] with no ulterior motives, no agendas, who would sacrifice everything for the betterment of nature…” Harry has been very vocal about his desire to live there, this is where his heart is, now, what does Africa have to do with this? Two opposite worlds!  When you love your partner, you do all kinds of things for each other. What are their dreams? How do you compromise to achieve those dreams? What makes them happy? How do you find ways to complement each other? That is true love to me. In this case, Harry has put those dreams aside and gone to Hollywood, a materialIstic, obsessive, cold world that has nothing to do with the warmth of Africa. Based on all this, yes, I do think Harry will regret his decision.  My opinion only. 
Prince Harry: 'I Will Always Look Up to' My Mother Meghan Markle was the fourth woman Prince Harry whisked to Botswana for romance Prince Harry Reflects on First Trip to Africa After Princess Diana’s Death https://www.express.co.uk/travel/articles/1023259/prince-harry-travel-news-pictures-south-africa-spice-girls Prince Harry: "I wish I could spend more time in Africa" | Channel Meno a Kwena

upvoters.user_id: Hera Ahmed Raja حِرا احمد راجہ

response.answer_text: To answer: Do you think Prince Harry will regret marrying Meghan Markle? I do not believe that Prince Harry will regret marrying Meghan Markle. Why? First, the public believes the image of their happy union together.Second, the public have no knowledge of a confirmed divorce as of today.Third, “There are no regrets in life, just lessons.” ― Jennifer AnistonForth. Prince Harry supports The Queen.Fifth: The Queen was appointed by God. Does Queen Elizabeth believe she was chosen by God?Sixth: No Regrets?I ponder, could Markle be A life lesson for the Sixth in Line? Succession to the British throne - Wikipedia Quotes About Living with NO Regret: “At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.”― Steve Maraboli, Life, the Truth, and Being Free “When you give yourself permission to communicate what matters to you in every situation you will have peace despite rejection or disapproval. Putting a voice to your soul helps you to let go of the negative energy of fear and regret.” ― Shannon L. Alder “Is it a weakness that I lead from my heart and not my head?” – Princess Diana To conclude: There is no mistaking that Harry is very much like his Mother, Diana. 7 Ways Prince Harry Is Just Like His Mother Princess Diana It is therefore my belief that Prince Harry does not live life with regret. Are Meghan Markle and Prince Harry soulmates? In my opinion, no.

Trying to second-guess other people is hard, even if we know a lot about them from the constant publicity. But my feeling is that the differences will sooner or later be too much to handle and there will be a separation and maybe a divorce. Harry has tried to get out of the media pressure cooker that he lives in by in effect resigning from the royal family. His apparent intention is to have a “normal” family life, insomuch as that will ever be possible, and in many ways that is commendable, but I feel that he is trying to run away from problems that will follow anyway, anywhere. So what is it with Meghan? For someone who is meant to-be a reliable actress, she has been singularly incapable of play the part of a royal. It really is a representative task, pure and simple; hold smiling, make feel-good small talk into average man or woman, be a ray of sunshine, become sponsor of great factors, and keep smiling. Oh, and maintain your knees together, never ever get across your feet. Meghan can’t do this. Insider gossip says your staff at the palace couldn't remain this lady and her foibles, plus she seems to have a remarkable decreased empathy for others. And that spills over into her public appearances. They say that males marry their particular mothers, but Meghan is not any Princess Diana who charmed the public. Otherwise, she does not have decorum. She appears to trigger arguments and rancor. She will not seem to have good commitment using various other royals, and especially the Queen, and she's operating Harry and William apart. She actually is in a people task, and she is bad with individuals. She provides impression, rightly or wrongly, that she simply wishes the life-style, the cash, the plaudits additionally the baubles. Simply put, a nouvelle riche who bagged a wealthy aristocrat. She must know of this, she must know that she is is inevitably being compared to Wallis Simpson, and she does nothing to deflect this criticism, or to inspire genuine affection. The key word is genuine; does she have genuine affection for anyone apart from herself? If she thinks she is creating a modern fairy tale, she may end up as the wicked witch rather than the princess. nonetheless it could change if she therefore wishes. Also it is much better for all worried if she did. And possibly, who knows? She might even read this.

I think he already knows he's made a humongous mistake in marrying her. Even if he doesn't right now, he will eventually. It's only a matter of time before he gets shot of her through a divorce, which she won't expect from him, or she leaves him which will make her even more hated than before because she broke his heart. She knew what she is doing when she got involved and he didn't. When and if the divorce happens, there is no chance in hell of her keeping custody of the kid, since the queen has that ultimate rein with regards to having custody of all of the grandchildren that has been born. I apologise for rambling and not making much sense.

Who knows? In that respect, they are like every other married couple. Sometimes a marriage works well enough to weather the storms of a lifetime together, and sometimes it doesn’t. I think it’s possible that Meghan could become fed up with life in a fishbowl, including the constant media intrusiveness and the various, often silly traditions and protocol associated with being a royal. I suspect you have to be born into that kind of life to be able to take it in stride. Whether she will be able to stick with it long enough for the public fascination to wane—which it eventually will—remains to be seen. Meghan isn’t Diana, and I doubt that she wants to become the media’s Diana replacement. Diana had an ax to grind, and she very much used the media for her own purposes. While Meghan has her various causes, I don’t think she has any love for the tabloid limelight. Could Harry ever fall out of love with her and regret marrying her? Sure. It happens every day the world over. I don’t see him as the type to acquire a mistress, but one never knows. If he ever did, I feel quite sure that Meghan, as a financially independent American, wouldn’t put up with it for two seconds. If there was ever an irreparable rift, regardless of the reason, she and her child would likely come back to the States. She could get a high-paying job in the entertainment industry in a heartbeat if she wanted to—just because of who she is.

This is a fiction: Once upon a time there was a young man who loved to live a free simple life but was never allowed to, because he was a prince. He met a lot of beautiful girls but never knew if they really loved him for himself or for his position. Then one day he met a beautiful young woman who had so much in common with him, they fell in love and married. She left all she had behind to follow him, though she was not happy in the stuffy castle. One day he confessed to her he could never tell what people really loved him for. She told him: "If you were a commoner, if you had no tittle and no privilege, I would still love you. If you had no money, I would work on my business and earn the money so that you could have your freedom". He said: " That was a dream I could never have before", and they rode into the sunset together. Some people think both the prince and his love in the story are nuts to leave privilege and wealth. Others say: "How romantic! She did not love him because he was born royal, and she did not marry him to get a tittle for herself. She did not marry him for money either, she is willing to make her own" I just hope they will live happily forever after

When are people going to give up on this stupid pantomime? The ‘royals’ are just human beings like anyone else. QE2 has ruined plenty of marriages, and shows no sign of kicking the habit. What a bunch. We have to pay for them, and then we have to put up with the endless pantomime. You will be right in thinking I am not a Royalist. There are only 3 functions for this bunch of well-heeled posers: Raking in the tourist dosh.The Queen being a part of the constitutional mechanism for appointing prime ministers, dissolving parliaments, and assenting bills.Giving the proletariat a convenient distraction to goggle at.QE2 has just about driven a stake through the marriage of Harry and Meghan. There is no other way to describe the brutality of her actions. Plenty of cause for regret from both partners in the cold light of a future day. QE2’s cool unempathic response to Diana’s strange death ran the risk of the monarchy being disbanded, something which folks like Corbyn would like to do, as you can’t have a monarch in a Marxist regime. If things go wrong with Harry and Meghan and either of them ends up penniless and drunk in a gutter, QE2 will be the one held accountable. For the misery of her sister Margaret (prevented from marrying Peter Townsend), for the disaster that was Charles and Diana (because she would not let Charles marry Camilla back then), and now for the Meghan & Harry mess. The public will take a view.

I sure hope so and soon! Hes just going to be drug down with her. I hope and pray he wakes up and sees who she really is. It's sad that he basically has lost everything dear to him before meeting her. That is not how love is suppose to go. I do think he was trying to be a man and sick up for his wife and child. I just think he does not see the true her. She has decided him from family and friends. Not unlike most abusers. He sees it as looking out for him but he is not seeing the deviciveness that she is using to do it. Very sad for Harry and where this will all end.

I know Harry Regrets marrying Meagan That girl knew what she was signing up for But now she wants to shake everything up Plain ridiculous I only feel for Harry He could have had his pick But Meagan forced him to choose Between his royal status and her She went and dropped that ghetto Ass looking baby and now she wants to call shots She is Common, Old and already been married Harry deserves way better That’s what you get when you let those kind of people into the Royal Family She stirred up all kinds of discontent Harry is beloved every since he lost his Mum when he was a young Prince. The entire world has wanted the best for him. Markle is not fit to be the wife of a common man But especially not our Prince Harry She is no Duchess she is a commoner And that is being nice I hope that Harry gets the wife he deserves Markle needs to leave the Prince alone Archie can come visit. Not Fit For The People’s Prince Harry! Leave him be!

Yes he probably regrets it all right now. Harry is under the control of Meghan who is a manipulator and narcissist. It is not all to do with Harry’s IQ or any lack of intelligence. Harry does not want to see or understand the way Meghan is controlling him. He is is asleep and under her control. Let us hope that he awakens and walks or runs to safety. He is in danger of losing his mind! He needs to speak to William and his father on how to cut loose from her manipulative overbearing presence. He is like someone who begins to see the captor as their master. i think Harry needs to understand the he will have more of his rights as as a father far away from this obsessive controlling narcissist!. I hope that he finds the courage to leave. It would seem that he gets more lost looking in every picture. He needs to see that Meghan is behaving as a mad dictator. He has been stripped of his personality. By breaking loose he will have a chance to recover and find himself as person and as a father. Come on Harry your Mother would want this! Your brother will help, as well as Her Majesty the Queen!

I don’t know if Regret is the proper word. I believe he will experience great pain if he is not already. Having buried his pains for years, he may well bury this one. His family would take him back I am sure, but they willnot take her. She has gotten him away from the family that loves him and she even has a “friend” moved in to where they are now. He is still the spare. His should take his son, get on a plane and head back home as quick as he can. He had accolodes within their sircle, he was part of the military, which he seemed to love, she pushed the buttoms and gramma pushed back. They would have welcomed her, sans all that drama, and she could have been another Kate Middleton, but she wanted to change the them all to her way of thinking. She knew what she got in to when the married. Maybe her family was not so far off the mark. Meghan loves Meghan. No one else. Poor Archie if they divorce and the baby is raised by her. She will get as much money as she can with Harry being part of it.

No. The two are obviously deeply in love. They're a young family trying to make their way in a manner which is best for them and their baby. They're both adults in their 30s, well travelled, highly educated, worldly and successful. The fact that this married couple has chosen to put their marriage first, and to raise their children in the way they feel is best for them, is understandable and healthy. The fact that they decided to reject the ongoing torment and racism which the tabloids had in store for them makes complete sense. Just because others before them have felt they had no option but to remain trapped in a gilded cage, Harry and Meghan realized they had the right to live their own lives. They saw the toll it took on the previous generations, even costing Princess Diana her life, and they chose not to be pushed along the same path. Many marriages, of course, do result in divorce, including several within the Royal Family itself. So there's always the possibility that this could occur. But this couple is actually taking steps to protect their family's happiness. I wish them the best.

Like any other marriage, these two went into the marriage very much in love. As to whether any of them will regret the marriage later, no one can say for sure. What we see now is that Harry loves his wife  She makes him smile   He is her strength. They have chemistry,  Which led to this  They have moments like these  Which couple doesn't?  My point is they laugh, they argue and they fight. They are a normal couple. As to whether Harry will regret it or not, time will tell. As for now Harry and his wife are happy  He is happy.

No, but he will regret his decision to split from the royals. Harry is now 35 years of age, and although I was a supporter , his constant wild child behaviour throughout the years is wearing me down. William lost his mother, and had to walk behind her coffin too, and has not behaved in this way. I believe we are to see yet another documentary in which he/they talk about the split,with Harry blaming others again. (How many times can they tell the same story) . Sorry, but I wish we could all let them live their lives in exile as they wished for it anyway. In time, if the Royal family is still here in the future, H&M will be line the Duke and Duchess of Windsor, forever on the outside. Time for Harry to grow up.

Yes, when it's all over said and done. He might already regret it but his ego wont let him admit it so he fills the RF will always be their for him so for now he's sticking with megan as she feeds him a line of BS hook line and sinker. Every passing day he digs his hole deeper and deeper, how long will the RF allow it? The RF has Diana on their conscious, mm knows how to work that to her advantage… playing for everything they have via lil H

In the short term no, but in the long term yes. Particularly after their announcement today. As has already been said by the press, they will not be able to have a low profile because all they do is draw attention to themselves. Prince Harry has never lived without the full support of his large family and he may find living without their support will be much harder than he expects.

Generally speaking, when two people with such different backgrounds marry it is a difficult journey. Add to this the fact he is royalty and she is a mixed race child of divorce with poor family relationships, problems certainly lie in their path. Experience says their marriage faces a precarious future at best. These two married in haste and sadly may live in regret. They certainly need our prayers.

In my opinion a few years down the line I believe Prince Harry will be sick and tired of Meghan's antics and her being disrespectful to his Grandmother her majesty Queen Elizabeth. I truly believe it hurt her majesty that they didn't go to her summer home with the excuse that the baby was to young. That is BS, I believe they knew her majesty would have liked a word with them. They also should leave his Mum Princess Diana out of this. It's too bad Harry didn't wait a little longer to meet someone who wasn't just after publicity and money. Wake up Prince Harry.

Nah, but I bet she already regrets marrying into Britain's most dysfunctional family. Diana is surely the gold standard for both press and familial abuse, but take a stroll through their shabby history. Margaret, Anthony Armstrong Jones, the Nazi Duke, the Nazi Queen Mother, the Germans, and keep travelling back. Would you honestly marry into that lot? Who knows, certainly not Quora, but Harry would have seen what it did to his Ma. He'd have to be one cold bastard to allow it for his wife. And Kate all alone now. She can have her nervous breakdown all by her self.

I think, if someone stays married long enough, there will be phases where they regret marrying their spouse, or getting married at all. The ones who get divorced are the ones who regretted getting married, and did something about it. For those who don’t get divorced I can’t see how you can be with someone for decades and not have phases where you are just sick of each other. If you are lucky it will turn around and you will be happy again. There are always those people married a very long time, who assert “I never once regretted marrying my beautiful wife/ wonderful husband.” I would be interested in what their partner would say.

No. (Her name is Meghan, BTW.) They seem very well suited, two independent people successful in their own right, both active in promoting charities and good causes. More importantly, they seem in love — and happy. Obsv, I can’t predict the future. Or see into other people’s hearts. But there are two possible narratives here. One is well-trodden by haters. I choose the other path. And I do not believe it is the less-traveled one.

Poor Harry, I do believe he thinks with the wrong head…he will regret his marriage…but he is “dim" and will stay in it for his child, which is honorable, but in the end will cause Archie more harm than good. I use to feel sorry for the mess Harry is in…but he seems to have drunk to much of meghans “kool-aid” and is becoming a mirror image of her…greedy, disrespectful, and toxic. Who, in their right mind, would want to be part of their turmoil.

No, the experience will have done him good especially if they have a stroppy break up. Meghan is an intelligent woman but she is not nice and that will be her undoing. The family courts in the UK are a secretive society and that is what she has to navigate. The other aspect is that she will have to navigate courts that pay allegiance to her husband’s grandmother who only has to raise an eyebrow. She won’t suffer but she will get stitched up. Look at Sarah Ferguson, got done up like a kipper.

I think Harry will regret this marriage, not for some time to come though. I honestly thought it was a match made in heaven, I thought it was wonderful he was allowed to marry his own choice, I felt she was beautiful and a breath of fresh air. Now, I see him being cast out, watching Meghan closely you can see she is very aware of the camera etc. I am so saddened out of all of this that William and Harry are no more, they had such a close bond, it is heartbreaking to see them now. I hope their marriage does work, I hope they do succeed in the path they have chosen, but, I really cannot see this happening, so sad.

No not at all. I think his situation is like Prince Andrew’s. Andrew loved Sarah but the tabloids and/or paparazzi clowns went crazy on her. Sarah fell apart mentally because of that hell. Those two are still together, just not married. Andrew’s love never died for Sarah. Harry loves Meghan too. The only thing he despises is the tabloid trash. Don’t know why people buy that tabloid garbage to begin with.

No. They clearly love each other dearly, have a mutual respect for each other and lean on one another in tough times. All of the individuals who are against their marriage clearly forget how unhappy Harry was in the royal family for years. He is part of a family that blatantly disregarded him as a child when they made him walk miles behind his mother's coffin in front of millions. He has consistently stated his want for a normal life. Meghan changed her whole life to be with him, and now he wants what she has previously. He is a man in love who is willing to change his life equally for his wife. If the British Media and certain public had not bullied, stalked, and essentially degraded them at every turn they would still be Royals. Typical of abusers; they don't even recognize how their own actions have consequences.

The Prince seems an honorable man. The vow he made to his wife will be sacred to hm. Also, they seem to really love each other! He may feel she is rescuing him from a fate worse than death. My former reply: I don’t think so=-and if he does, I don't think anybody will ever know. He does not want to treat a woman the way his mother was treated. I think he really loves her. And she loves him. Let these people alone to work out their own lives and destinies!

Probably in the long run. When he’s no longer whipped, misses his country and family, stops seeing her as ‘exotic’ because she’s mixed and pretty, and starts seeing her for what she really is. Maybe he won’t. Maybe she’s really sweet and kind and has no other motive than to be with him because she loves him and not the glamorous life. Who knows? I don’t wish ill on anyone but….. Please.

Probably he will look gain at some point in his life the clarity he is missing now. Meghan knew what she was doing. He lost his mother who got away from Royal family, and he lost her soon after she got away from them. To him, “outside the family” is where he lost his mother. That young boy walking behind the coffin wished he could’ve protected his mother since. What he is doing now is trying to re-write the history. Unfortunately, this is not possible. However, it did match Meghan’s agenda: so she pushed for it.

Yes sadly I think he well, has much has Harry wanted a little freedom I don't think it was to be away from the RF ,He was hoping to and with the help when he married his wife would be by his side helping him it was not to be like that with MM I don't think she had any interest in the RF but for the fantastic wedding and she wanted the Titles etc But could are did not won't to live in the shadow of Prince Kate, I really hope Harry and Megan can be happy but if she thought it was hard being in the RF Poor Harry well find it so much harder so no this marriage won't work.

No. Let me tell you why. Even if they do end up separating he will have somehow benefitted from the experience, hadnt he, he would always have wondered. I married and 23 yrs later left my husband. I dont regret it one iota. At the time I 100% knew he was right for me but as time went on it became evident his bizarre behaviours would ultimately pull me down too.

The couple indicated that they would not settle in the US as long as our current POTUS is in charge. MM called him 'divisive' and pledged to move to Canada if he won in 2016. Harry stating that they had to avoid the press as shutter clicks remind him of his mom's demise. MM doesn't seem to avoid the shutter clicks as she smiles for the camera. MM courts attention and has taken what some might call a circuitous route to LA. Harry may have outlived his usefulness in the megxit scheme as her plan did not include the loss of the Royal title. Tho he pimped her for Disney voice over and could work as her manager. Sweet little Harry may wind up in a crumpled heap when she has finished with him.

Here's the thing, astrologically speaking. Meghan has Cancer rising (ascendant) and this makes her motherly towards Harry. It also makes her love the home as much as the stage. Harry is eating it all up like the 12 year old emotionally stunted boy, stuck in the trauma of losing his mother. I don't mean this at all maliciously, but factually. It's plain as day to me that all that Meghan clinginess also satisfies Harry's deep unresolved need for his mother. It's a perfect emotional fit, albeit a co-dependent one. I think Harry would be incapable of letting go of Meghan for that very reason. She's his momma and his wife.

Yes. If he hasn’t already had regret in his heart. She played him & had that baby pronto to seal the deal. Harry will be marginalized from Royalty & his usual crowd. Who’d want Meghan around for a weekend outing. Not many in their circles. Ahhh. Harry want we’re you thinking. Oh wait-he wasn’t!!!! Yup Harry will regret marrying her.

Maybe he is regretting but is not going to do anything now or even later. Or maybe not regretting anything?! I can only guess that he might miss having a relationship with his brother—I can only guess there is communication or perhaps there is no communication now. Or I could be completely wrong and he may not miss any royal family member now or ever. He must be aware of his and Meghan’s actions are not a golden success and overtime their “Brand” is not as valuable as they thought outside of Palace life. What was their brand to do—given ‘talks for pay’, product endorsement… product development, charity benefits, Meghan to go back to acting? There does seem to be a striking resemblances to the Duke of Windsor and Harry right now.. time will tell that story more vividly.

I would expect that he already knows he made the wrong choice . He was bamboozled by MM. I had never heard of her before she met The prince. She has watched and learned how to maneuver herself quickly to gain access to Who might know someone.. MM is not a great talent, she is a climber. She is a “sweetheart of a friend” to women that were connected. A User. Her claim to fame and Money is set now. Back in LA. Has wealth and we know who she is. Never could do it on hr own. She will leave Harry. She has this planned .

No, he will not regret it. I am appalled at some of the nasty responses to this question. Harry has wanted out of the royal life for years and has balked several times when he was younger. His grandmother was not blindsided in this…they have been talking about it for several months. By all accounts, by those who know her best, Meghan has a kind heart and is a good person. Harry loves her, and he is bent on protecting her and their child and will not let what happened to his mother happen to his wife. He has said that.

If he's smart, he will but unfortunately I think he's rather dimwitted and star-struck by Meghan though I don't know why? He has been put under a Meghan Markle spell and he would be too proud to admit in front of his family that he made a mistake in choosing the wrong partner. His family would never let him forget it. Meghan is very good at playing the victim, and Harr falls for it every time.

I think that possibly he already regrets marrying her so quickly. Yes, she has given him a son, but he’s lost the rest of his family in the meantime. But I think that the realization of the gravity of what he’s done, wont sink in until Queen Elizabeth passes away. He will eventually tire of this new life. He’s been a Royal for 35 years. Old habits die hard.

As being a ROYAL he probably will. She is NOT ROYAL material. NOTHING about her spells Royal. Harry was his moms baby, no one could possibly know what impact this played in his life. He wasn't even allowed to mourn her in public. The Royals just wanted to shut the door on that chapter. She was Diana to us, she was mum to him. As a woman I don't see the attraction to Meghan, where as I would probably pass out in the presence of Katy, she REEKS of class. She is a true ROYAL. Yes I don't doubt regret will fail upon this unity.

As he is not my friend, or even someone I am personally acquainted with, I don't know nor do I care. The state of Prince Harry's marriage and his thoughts on it is nobody's business but his and his wife's (and anyone they choose to be involved in it). It is certainly not any of our business, even if they are famous. How would you like it if perfect strangers started prying into your personal life and speculated about your love life?

I think he married her knowing she'd be okay with no title. THEY decided to leave. Harry knows the rules. No title was always a known part of the equation. She knew. She didn't care. I don't know her. I watched Suits, loved the show, enjoyed her role. But I don't know her. I do know that there are reports of Harry wanting to leave the royal family for several years so she married him knowing that. She's helping him make that happen. Kind of shoots the haters in the foot who say she married the title! I guess they have to find something else to take issue with…oh, I know! Her hair! Let's all pick on her hair. *rolls eye

Well, it is a tough marriage but they may last. Especially if Meghan half sister would try to get a life. She is such a disgrace and act like a good hood rat. She always bad mouthing Meghan and act like she doesn't have any class. Marriage in America have about a 50 per cent chance and I don't know about Britain. It may work because they both seem to love each other and they both seem to be rebels…they against the world. Harry is sensitive and remember how his mother was treated and appears to have compassion. Now if Megan half sister will stop disgracing the White women of America.

I don't think think Harry will regret marrying meghan markle. I actually think they are extremely well suited. They no their position in the royal family and now they have thrown their dummies out of the pram. Now they want to show William and Kate ( whom they are completely jealous of)look what we can do without you knowing that we are better than you. We are now famous in our own way. It's either quite laughable or quiet sad. Because Harry will need the royals one day.

I think he will stick it out, but the gossip might get to him. Megan new what he was supposed to do as a senior member of the Royal Family. She lucked out, he chose her. but to lose standing and your title in the Royal Family, I think he f***** up. but no one really know what's going on in their lives. so I am saying keep your f****** nose out of their business. but I really don't give a fuk if they break up, big deal.
Fair comment..there is also one other ‘room elephant’..I’ll post it..I make no comment

I think Prince Harry will, in time, regret marrying Megan. She is an out of work so called actress who is using Prince Harry to her advantage. She is a user, very false and if Prince Harry was just a “normal” man and not royalty she would have not been interested. I hope Prince Harry will see her for what she is, divorce her and return to the UK and the Royal family!! Where he belongs..

I think he already regrets it, but is hanging in there because of his son. I can only hope Harry’s wife does not become pregnant again. Having another child, which I really don’t believe she wants, would be cramping her style”and from what I’ve read, she is too busy to care for her son most of the time.

Definitely! The bing bang thank you, mam has gone out the window. She is way too needy and pretentious. He is probably saying what the bloody hell did I do? It’s the matter of the baby that's holding him back from booking a flight back home. I would give it a year or so, and we will be seeing him back in the UK for good without M.
No , he will not regret, he will stay for ever as a little boy who needs a leader next to him. Megan is, and she will use him as long as she gets sick of his weakness.

I'm sure as with most marriages both partners have the occasional “what was I thinking” thought so I'm sure Prince Harry is no exception. The difference is the reality of splitting up a family and assets puts the average persons life in perspective and the thought passes. With the ultra wealthy the outcome of divorce is less life changing and are more likely to follow through on their whim.

As one who was married to a Lutheran Pastor and had to learn to live on a limited income it is hard for me to relate to people of Royal fame and the lifestyle that is handed to them. For the sake of Archie I am hopeful that the family squabbles will have a good conclusion. I would recommend Meghan gives us her ambition to show the world her acting ability but would honor the Queen and they would go back to London. She married into the family and should honor Harry’s family. Being a “brat” is not becoming to a woman of her age that is keeping the baby away from a Grandmother who dearly loves Harry and his son. A little growing up would solve all of their problems.
